tourName: Complete tour of Sri Lanka, tailor made
generalInfo:
This Holiday covers best of Sri Lanka has to offer from North to South. You will be discovering the 2000 years old ancient cities, awe inspiring Hindu temples in Jaffna, spotting elephants, buffaloes, sloth bear, blue whales and leopards, exploring the tea plantations and waterfalls, experiencing Yal Devi train journey to Jaffna and hill country and unwinding in the sandy beaches. You will have your own personal chauffeur guide with car. So you can experience Sri Lanka at your own pace.

PACKAGE DETAILS
Sri Lanka Grand Tour with Jaffna can be fully personalised suit your preferences. Price includes Return economy flights from London Heathrow with Sri Lankan Airlines, excursions, entry fees, local guides
Transport: Private luxury A/C car with Chauffeur Guide
Hotels: Mixture of 3 & 4 star hotels with home stays on Half Board basis


Highlights of the Tour:
Experience Queen of Jaffna Yal Devi train journey
Spectacular Nallur Kovil Temple
Exploring the Jaffna Peninsula
War Memorials of Kilinochi
Discover the Royal Kingdom of Anuradhapura (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Trincomalee & Pigeon Island
Experience Dambulla Golden Rock Cave Temple (UNESCO World Heritage)
Stunning Sigiriya Rock fortress (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Medieval city of Polonnaruwa ancient ruins (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Visit Kandy’s Temple of the Tooth (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Tea tasting in the Tea plantation in Nuwara Eliya
Panoramic train journey through tea hills and waterfalls above 1500 meters
Watch the feedings of elephants in Elephant Transit Home Udawalawe
Spotting leopards and elephants in Yala National park Safari
Bird Watching Boat Safari at Kalametiya Bird Sanctuary
Stilt fisherman of Weligama
Explore Dutch Galle Fort (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Relax and unwind in Golden sandy beaches
Taste fresh sea food and Sri Lankan curry

dayInfo.description: Chilaw: “Ayubowan” & ‘’Vanakkam’’ Welcome to tropical paradise. You will be welcomed & greeted by your guide or representative on arrival at the Waiting Area at the recently refurbished Modern BIA International Airport. You will travel to Chilaw. Travel time approximately an hour and 20 minutes depend on the road traffic. Hotel: Anantaya on Half Board

Chilaw > Wilpattu: After breakfast you will travel to Wilpattu National Park for the afternoon Safari 4×4. Safari 3 hours: Wilpattu National Park (‘Land of Lakes’) is situated in the Northwest coast near the ancient city of Anuradhapura. It is the largest and oldest National park in Sri Lanka consisting 140,000 hectares of mostly dry zone evergreen forest cover and coastal belt to the West. This is one of best places see leopards in Sri Lanka alongside Yala National Park. Hotel: Palm Garden on Half Board

Wilpattu: Today you can take a morning or afternoon Safari to Wilpattu National Park as you prefer. You can also explore the local area abundant with rare birds. The Eco Lodge naturalist will be happy to do a river walk to spot the birds, dragon flies and butterflies. Or you can visit the local village where you can see traditional pottery making and visit the local school. Hotel: Palm Garden on Half Board

Wilpattu > Anuradhapura: After breakfast you will visit The Scared City of Anuradhapura. Anuradhapura stands equal to Pyramids at Giza on the architectural level during their time. This magical place with enormous Dagobas, palaces, monasteries and monuments evidence one of the greatest civilisations in the world. The scared city of Anuradhapura was first Royal Kingdom and capital of Sri Lanka that lasted for 1,500 years until it was abandoned after the invasion by South Indian Cholas in 993. Hotel: The Sanctuary on Half Board

Anuradhapura > Jaffna: After breakfast at 10:15am you travel to Jaffna by train (Yal Devi – Queen of Jaffna) arriving at 14:17hrs. Yal Devi train resumed service between Colombo to Jaffna in restored tracks in 2014 after almost 25 years in absence due to the war. During the war the tracks was completely damaged. The Guardian & Telegraph ranked this train journey and northern Jaffna as in their top places to go in 2015. Hotel: Jaffna Heritage Hotel on Half Board

Jaffna: After breakfast you will visit Nallur Kandaswamy Temple, this fascinating Hindu temple also known Kovil in Tamil and shrine. It is dedicated to God Murugan – (God of Tamils). Nallur was part of once thriving Jaffna Kingdom. In the afternoon you will explore Jaffna Fort – Clock Tower – Jaffna Library. You will then proceed to Oddtumadam, through Araly Road, Karainagar – Casuarina Beach . The return journey will be through Mathagal – Keerimalai Tank – Mavettapuram Knathasami Kovil (Historical Temple) – Thellipalai Amman Kovil (Historical Temple) – Chuunakam – Kantharodai and finally through KKS Road to Jaffna University and back to the Hotel. Hotel: Jaffna Heritage Hotel on Half Board

Jaffna > Kilinochchi > Trincomalee: After breakfast you will travel to Trincomalee en-route you will visit Kilinochchi and Elephant Pass, after one and a half hours’ drive you will reach Elephant Pass (The War Remembrance Monument, Hasalaka Gamini Memorial and the damaged LTTE war tank) after half an hours’ drive you will reach Kilinochchi (War Remembrance Wall, the war affected areas and the damaged water tank). From here you will proceed to Eranaimadu water tank. Thereafter you will be taken to see the famous Murikandi Temple and will have lunch at Testa Hotel. Afterwards you will continue to Trincomalee in the East. Hotel: Pigeon Island on Half Board

Trincomalee: Today you will visit Koneswaram Temple is also known as Tirukoneswaram Kovil (Hindu temple) which is situated on top of Swami Rock. This temple is dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva, and it is one out of five such temples situated around Sri Lanka. It is believed that this Kovil has been in existence since 2500 years ago, and was renovated by the south Indian Chola king Kulakottan and maintained by other Sinhala Buddhist kings. After lunch you will have discover the World War II cemetary and the city. Trincomalee is a port city and has the fifth largest natural harbour in the world. The city is surrounded by lagoons, bays and hills and situated in a peninsula. This port city has a history worth exploring, the strategic location of the natural harbour made it a city worthwhile conquering, and hence it was conquered by the Portuguese, Dutch and the British. Trincomalee is fondly referred to as Trinco by the locals, the anglicized Tamil word ‘Trincomalee’ denotes the meaning lord of the sacred hill. Hotel: Pigeon Island on Half Board

Trincomalee > Sigiriya: After breakfast you travel to Sigiriya in the Cultural Triangle. En-route you will visit a fishing village, here the local people depend on agriculture such as buffalo curd making and lake fishing from the Kantale Lake. The villagers will show how they make buffalo curd and dry the fish; you are welcome to participate as well. This area produces the best buffalo curd in Sri Lanka and milking the buffalo is very much delicate affair pass from one generation to another. Afterwards enjoy the lunch with the dry fish and local specialities Sigiriya is situated in the Cultural Triangle of Sri Lanka. One of the Asia’s major archaeological centres, home to 4 of the UNESCO World Heritage sites. The ruins and temple date back to 4th century B.C. The Cultural Triangle used to be the home of ancient Kingdoms. The area is full of culture, history and wildlife. Here the ancient Kings have developed one of the sophisticated and advanced civilisations of Sri Lanka. Hotel: Kassapa Lions Rock on Half Board

Sigiriya: After breakfast you will climb Sigiriya Rock Fortress. Sigiriya is a UNESCO World Heritage site which is proposed to be the 8th wonders of the World. Sigiriya, a massive rock in the green scrub jungle, is perhaps the most memorable place for visitors to Sri Lanka. Afterwards enjoy Ayurveda massage to rejuvenate your bodies. Ayurveda is the ancient health care system in South Asia that has been passed down from father to son and based on herbs and diet. It is one of the world’s oldest forms of healing and treatment. You will find some of the best Ayurveda practitioners in Sri Lanka. Hotel: Kassapa Lions Rock on Half Board

Sigiriya > Polonnaruwa: After breakfast you will discover Polonnaruwa, was the mediaeval capital of Sri Lanka, and today it is one of the most beautiful centres of Sri Lanka’s cultural heritage and UNESCO Heritage site. With its comparatively brief history and a dozen rules, it is far more completely preserves ruin than Anuradhapura. Visit the ancient ruins and Gal Vihara complex, where 3 gigantic Buddha’s statues are carved out of a single rock. You also will be able to see the toque macaque monkeys found only in Sri Lanka. Hotel: Kassapa Lions Rock on Half Board

Sigiriya > Kandy: After breakfast you will visit Dambulla Cave temple en-route to Kandy. Dambulla Golden Rock Cave Temple is a vast isolated rock mass 500ft high and a 1.6 km around the base. Here is found the impressive Rock Temple dating to the First Century BC. After Dambulla Cave Temple you can visit Spice Gardens if you like to. SPICE GARDENS – For centuries the indigenous herbs and spices have been used for both medicinal purposes and in traditional Sri Lankan cuisine. To visit a Spice Garden is to open up your senses to smells and tastes, old and new. Cinnamon, ginger, vanilla and cardamom are just some of the spices available in the numerous Spice Gardens between Dambulla and Kandy. Aluvihara Cave Temple is a set of cave temples in between the huge boulders. Aluvihara plays a significance role in the history of Buddhism, since it was here that the most important set of Theravada Buddhist scriptures, the Tripitaka, or “Three Baskets”, were first committed to writing. After wards you will continue to Kandy. Hotel: Tourmaline on Half Board

Kandy: Sri Lanka’s second largest city of Kandy is a beautiful historical city in the citadel of the country. It is not only known for its great kings who ruled the city for almost 225 years independently until the British took over in 1815, but it is also the place where the Sacred Tooth of Lord Buddha is laid in a magnificent temple. After breakfast you will visit The Temple of the Tooth & Buddhist Museum. Sri Dalada Maligawa dates back to the 16th century, though most of the present buildings were built in the 19th century. Venerated as the most important object in the Buddhist world, the Sacred Relic of the Tooth of Buddha is enshrined at the Temple. Brought from India 2500 years ago, it is said that the possessor of the Relic had the right to rule the country. The Relic is kept in a gold casket and stored amidst great security in the Inner Chamber. In the afternoon you explore the Kandy City & markets. It is great place for shopping or just walks around the Lake and enjoys the beautiful scenery and narrow streets. Hotel: Tourmaline on Half Board

Kandy: After breakfast you will visit Peradeniya botanical garden. The botanical garden of Peradeniya, near Kandy, was firstly established in the 14th century. Since British times Peradeniya has become one of the finest botanical gardens in Asia. When the British eventually wrested control of the Kandyan Kingdom in 1815, the site at Peradeniya was a Royal Pleasure Garden, apparently being enjoyed by the last Queen of Kandy. In typical fashion, the British were quick to establish their own indelible stamp on this lush corner that exists in the cradle of a deep bend in the wide and languid river, the Mahaweli. In the evening you will see Traditional Kandyan Dance – Kandy, Rich in colour and agile in their movements, the Kandyan Dancers evoke images of pageantry and traditions past. Lively and exuberant, spellbinding and hypnotic, a Cultural Show is a spectacle to remember with its nimble dancers, energetic drummers and fireproof firewalkers. Hotel: Tourmaline on Half Board

Kandy > Nuwara Eliya: After breakfast you will travel to Nuwara Eliya. As the road winds up, you will pass picturesque waterfalls, tumbling down hillsides and vantage points, which afford views over a panorama of rugged hills stretching far into the distance. This is the home of the Sri Lankan tea industry and as you gain in altitude, neatly manicured tea estates become a familiar part of the landscape, acres of tea bushes extending over the hills on either side of the road. There are many view points to stop and enjoy the this breath taking views. Afternoon explore Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya is often referred to as ‘Little England’ Nuwara Eliya has a climate unlike anywhere else in Sri Lanka. Due to its high elevation it offers a cooler and more invigorating climate than lower regions. Colonised by the British, the outskirts of the Sri Lanka’s highest town, still retain their ‘ye olde worlde’ feel and many of the original Hotels still retain their grandiose colonial style. Hotel: Grand Hotel on Half Board

Nuwara Eliya: After an early breakfast, an adventurous ride to the Horton Plains National Park, a plateau with an elevation of 2,134 m, sparsely populated, almost without any roads. Here you walk about 4 hours through mystic cloud forests and Patna grassland to “Worlds End”, where the highland falls steeply almost a thousand meters, and the Bakers Falls. Horton Plains National Park is home to rare flora and fauna; Sambar and Bear-monkey as well as many birds. Horton Plains is located on a high windswept saddle at 2134 meters elevation; these plains are hard to reach. Evening Dinner at the Hill Club Nuwara Eliya – You will be able to experience the British Colonial Traditions and travel back in time. From 7.00 pm onwards the Dress Code is applicable. Hotel: Grand Hotel on Bed & Breakfast

Nuwara Eliya > Ella: After breakfast around midday you will experience of the most breathtaking train journeys for 2.50 hours. You will travel from Nanuoya to Ella through tea plantations and rolling hills on Old Colonial train with scenic view. This train journeys recorded in the Guinness Books of Records as the one of the world best scenic train journeys. Ella is described as one of the most breathtaking locations in Sri Lanka. Ella is surrounded by high mountains in the central hills and through a gap in the mountains you can see all the way to the ocean off the Hambantota coast line. This special gap which is having breathtaking views is called Ella Gap. Hotel: Mount Heaven on Half Board

Ella: After breakfast you will visit Lipton Tea Estate Experience: Experience the process and lifestyle within a tea estate. Tea is known as Sri Lanka’s green gold and the tea estate provides insight into British colonial past and role of tea in Sri Lanka today. The scenic views from the tea estates are breathtaking. After tea estate you can explore the nearby waterfalls or visit the magnificent Nine Arch Bridge between Ella and Demodara stations are just a few kilometres along the track from the Demodara station. Hotel: Mount Heaven on Half Board

Ella > Yala: If you like early morning you hike to see the sunrise from Little Adam’s Peak. Little Adam’s Peak resembles the main Adam’s Peak near Hatton. By foot it takes about 35-40 minutes. Here you will be able to enjoy the breathtaking views of an endless valleys, tea plantations and waterfalls. After breakfast you will visit the Udawalawe National Park Elephant Transit Home en-route to Yala. Elephant Transit Home (ETH), where the orphan wild elephants are treated, raised and released back to the wild, also is located at Udawalawe. Visitors to this place can observe how the elephants are taken care of, twice a day. Total number of orphaned elephants exceeds 40, of which most of them are calves and juveniles. Hotel: Elephant Reach on Half Board

Yala: Morning or afternoon safari in the one of the best National Park’s in Asia for spotting elusive leopards. The Yala National Park is the best place on the planet for spotting and photographing leopards in the wild. The best times to spot these magnificent creatures roaming freely around the park are early mornings or in the evening. Estimates state that there are between 500 – 650 leopards living in Sri Lanka. The Sri Lankan Leopard is a recognized subspecies of the Indian Leopard and is the largest leopard living in Asia making this wildlife safari experience one that is not easily forgotten. Hotel: Elephant Reach on Half Board

Yala > Tangalle: After breakfast you will travel to Tangalle along the coastal road. Rest of the day you can relax. Evening: Beach Candle lit Seafood Dinner with Giant Prawns Hotel: Turtle Bay on Half Board

Tangalle: After breakfast you will take a boat trip around the Kalametiya: Kalametiya Bird Sanctuary is an extensive area of wetland with brackish lagoons, mangrove swamps, open grassy areas and pockets of scrub jungle. It provides sanctuary for the common wetland birds. Rest of the day you can relax or take walk in the palm fringed picture postcard beach. Hotel: Turtle Bay on Half Board

Tangalle > Mirissa: Today you will travel to Mirissa after visiting Mulkirigala Rock Temple. A magnificent ancient monastery situated on a boulder that rises virtually perpendicularly from the surrounding plains, except for one slopped side. The beautiful ancient wall paintings of the monastery are breathtaking as is the panoramic view from the summit. You can the see Stilt Fisherman near the village of Weligama. Weligama is famous for its stilt fishermen, visitors can see this unique sight only in this part of Sri Lanka. No-one knows where, or even when this form of fishing originated, but it is an old tradition which lives on in a modern world today. Rest of the day you can relax and enjoy the beach or explore the cinnamon and rubber plantations nearby. Hotel: Mandara Mirissa on Half Board

Mirissa > Galle: Blue Whale Watching: You’ll leave early morning around 06:30am from your hotel to see the Blue Whales. Mirissa is the most reliable site in the world for seeing the difficult and desired Blue Whale. It may also be the best place for seeing Sperm Whales too. Blue whales are the largest animals ever lived on earth growing up to some 33 metres long, weighing up to some 150-180 metric tons. They live individually or in very small pods or groups and frequently swim in pairs. In the afternoon you will travel to Galle passing some beautiful coastal villages. Home Stay: Dominic Villa on Half Board

Galle: In the morning you travel to the markets with your host to buy ingredients for your dinner. In the afternoon you will discover the Dutch Fort. There are many boutique shops along the narrow streets of the Fort as well as antiques, art and craft shops. Galle is situated in the southern Sri Lanka. It is the best example of a fortified city built by Europeans in south and Southeast Asia, showing the interaction between European architectural styles and south Asian traditions. The Galle fort is a UNESCO world heritage site and the largest remaining fortress in Asia built by European occupiers. Evening culinary experience & Cooking lesson with your home stay hosts; it’s an experience to learn about Sri Lankan food.

Galle > Colombo: After breakfast you will travel to Mount Lavinia in the suburb of Colombo. Mount Lavinia Hotel used to be governor’s residence during the British Empire. After check-in you travel to Colombo. In the afternoon you will discover Colombo City, drive through the city taking you to the busy commercial areas as well as the tree-lined residential, Cinnamon Gardens. Visit Fort, the former British administrative centre and military garrison, Sea Street – the Goldsmith’s quarters in the heart of Pettah, the Bazaar area, where is also a Hindu Temple with elaborate stone carvings and the Dutch Church of Wolfendhal dating back to 1749. Also visit the BMICH and Independence Square. Hotel: Mount Lavinia Hotel on Half Board
Colombo > Airport: You will travel to the airport depend on your departure time.
